intro: Phragmanthera polycrypta, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, velvety texture. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed habitats. Phragmanthera polycrypta is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes other plants such as hibiscus and cotton.
